./.title: 1. Phase 1 Training Module
./.body: Welcome to the World of Packt Videos!  This training module is divided in 3 phases comprising of videos and assignments. At the end of this training, you'll learn to create great videos!

how_to_record_a_video.html.title: 1.0 How to Record a Video
how_to_record_a_video.html.body: How to Record a Video    In this video we will look at the steps for recording great videos! Let's get started.

video_workflow.html.title: 1.1 Video Workflow
video_workflow.html.body: Authoring a Packt Video  In this video we are going to learn 7 easy steps to author a video course with Packt Publishing.

videoapproach.html.title: 1.2 Video Approach
videoapproach.html.body:
Video First Approach  Record the Videos    Each video will be within 5 to 8 minutes and will cover 1 topic within the section. Get the videos reviewed    Our technical reviewers will review the screencasts and provide feedback.  Polish the Videos    Address the reviwer comments and polish the content in your videos.  Involves video recording at the initial stage.  


  Single stage finalization. 


  Pre-planned content. 


  Recommended if you are an expert at recording video or screencasts. 


  Does not facilitate easy revisions.

video_recording_settings.html.title: 1.3 Video Recording Settings
video_recording_settings.html.body:
Video Recording Settings 



 When recording a screencast, you can have a number of choices when it comes to using the recording software. To standardize the settings, you have to make sure the following settings are met irrespective of the software used. Before sending the screencasts to us, they need to be converted using the following settings. 



    1. The first and the most important thing is to ensure the default desktop resolution is set to 1280 x 720.    2. All applications in should in all cases run in full screen so that the viewer’s attention is centered only on the area which is being explained.    3. Aspect Ratio should always be at 1280 x 720p. The half HD format is the standard we use to ensure universal usage and visibility.   4. Font Size should be 16 px, such that it is seen on any hand held device.   5. Codec    For Windows: Lagarith Lossless Video Codec 

    For Mac: Animation Codec 

   6. Frame Rate : Anywhere between 25 fps or 30 fps, but should be constant throughout.   7. Frame Rate Mode (when recording): Constant   8. Audio Recording Format: 44.1Khz Stereo, 16 bit   9. File Format should be in MP4    10. Codec: H264    11. Frame Rate Mode (while exporting): Constant    12. Video Bit Rate: Unchanged    13. Audio Bit Rate: 256 Kbps

audio_recording_tips.html.title: 1.4 Audio Recording Tips
audio_recording_tips.html.body:
Audio Recording Tips   Good Quality Audio Narration 
   The quality of your narration helps onscreen learning. Practice your narration before you record your screencast.     Find a Quiet Spot in your House     Avoid noise as much as possible. If noise overlaps your speech, post production audio cleaning tends to degrade audio quality.   Choose the Right Mic      Different mics have different recording characteristics. Reading the brochure should help understand its characteristics.    Place Blankets/Pillows Around your Recording Equipements    This helps cancel out noise from equipements like PCs and laptops.Clap Around the Room      This helps detect rooms or areas with echo. Avoid rooms with echoes as it cannot be edited out of your narration.    A Room with Furniture Helps Cancel Echo    Wood and other absorbing textures dampen echo and enhance audio quality. Record in a room that has furniture.   Clothes are the Best Way to Avoid Echoes    It's preferable to work in a room with clothes hung on all sides.  Avoid Editing Your Audio    Do not use preset filters or noise removal techniques in your audio.   Maintain a Steady Distance from the Mic  Always maintain a fixed distance from the mic. Place it ideally 10cms from your mouth. Listen to Your Narration    You can always improvise before you submit the content.

sample_video.html.body:
Example Video   This video will give you an idea about how a final video should look like

creatingtechnicalcourses.html.body: Creating Great Technical Courses    This video will explain in detail on how we can go about creating some great technical courses.
